title: Conduct Feasibility Study Economic Analysis
description: A mining engineer performs an economic analysis for a new mine project, calculating its Net Present Value (NPV) to determine if it is financially viable.

tasks.description: Gather all inputs for the financial model: the LOM production schedule, commodity price forecast, and estimates for capital and operating costs.
tasks.expected_outcome: All necessary data is compiled for the economic model.

tasks.description: Build a discounted cash flow (DCF) model for the project life.
tasks.expected_outcome: A year-by-year cash flow model is created.

tasks.description: Calculate the project's NPV and Internal Rate of Return (IRR) to support an investment decision.
tasks.expected_outcome: The model calculates a positive NPV and an IRR above the company's hurdle rate, indicating a viable project.
